column5: Headed down this weekend to the brown zone to do some bouncing. Weather was poor to say the least. Windy, high water but we made the best of it and got some fishing in. The rain was a bit of a blessing as it knocked the crowds right down we even got a shot at "the drift". we ended up it 9 or so fish on sat and a few break offs. Today was cold and slow. not many rods moving. We managed a nice hen, watched a fist fight on the river bank that ended up with a guy in the river and packed it in.Camera wasnt working right in the rain so some of the pics didnt turn out but heres some from the weekend.Good mix of fish really enjoy.  Ryan
Nice fish, and a bonus laker.  Good to hear everyone had good manners
Sweet fish bro!
Really nice report and pics... beauty fish too!!!  I really like those beautiful Browns!!!
nice fishin fellas! great pictures!   Hawk
Wow...no crowds and fish...gotta love that combination!  Doesn't matter what the weather is doing, if fish are being caught then it's all worth it.  Love those browns!
WOW...some really nice sized browns for sure,great pics too...cheers
Great report and pics troutguy  Beautiful browns guys.... WTG Great job and thanks for sharing Leechman
Great report with not only some fish action but some shoreline brawling!!  Thanks, and great job
Great looking fish, love the colours on the browns.
Where's the pics of the fight?????  p.s Nice fish.
I'm pretty jealous, I stayed in this weekend.... shouldnt have
Nice browns Bud... Looks like you didn't have to wait for the hardwater to hit a nice laker !!! Im starting to get the itch for Kempenfelt Bay already
Im seeing a lot of reports coming from this place ... where is it?

aha, that's funny man,m Imagine that a fist fight at Port Da Looser   it's reasons like that I have not really put any effort into fishing shore there for years..always some kind of ongoing soap opera with 30-40 guys fishing "the wall"  I have seen scraps between guys fishing opposite sides of the harbour like that..casting huge sinkers,tangling eachothers lines up from across the channel, guys hopping in cars to run over the the oppposite side to scrap with the other guys..it gets prettystupid at times  I was there a couple times in the last week in my boat, one day I counted 36 people fishing in that spot.  Good going on the fish,sorry to hear you got an example of the "fine anglers" that hang out there at times  Thanks for sharing the pics, fishing is picking up there, we been getting a few browns and bows in the boat
Wicked fishin guys.  Not that I suggest it, but some of those browns contain the secret to winter steelhead!

Its definatly a soap opera, I wasnt all that surprised to see the one fella in the middle of it end up in the river, he seems to always be there swearing at someone. I guess you never know who you might piss off.  How well do the boats do there?  I had mine with me but never bothered even using it, I dont think I've seen a boat with a fish on.    Kemper  indeed they do
Looks like you guys had a great day!
i was down there sat nite, the fish were on fire till the current shut off, every 3min you had one on, wind was nasty but the fish were copperating
i was down there sat nite, the fish were on fire till the current shut off, every 3min you had one on, wind was nasty but the fish were copperating
if there is a good current and drift you can do pretty good, often putting 12-15 fish or so in the boat
Roe spillage. Man those are some beauties helps clear the image out of my head of the last one I saw  .
